title: Bug 113047 - No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the children node listing is not displayed. After closing and reopening the data set editor, the issue persists.
EB: The data set editor page in the query tab should list the children nodes when changing the data source for a data set.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement.
2. Ensure that the new data source does not have any database, table, or column information.
3. Change the data source for the data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
4. Verify that the children node listing is not displayed.
5. Close the data set editor.
6. Reopen the data set editor and observe that the issue still exists.
